• In addition to static file hosting, special files are transparently run through a powerful yet simple templating engine named Jekyll after every push to GitHub.

  • Because Jekyll sites are ultimately stored as static files, they are incredibly fast and scale very well.

  • Jekyll allows you to style pages with reusable templates. This template-driven approach helps you to build larger sites in a very manageable way.

Tell a corny inception joke about GitHub Pages and Jekyll being used to write this presentation about GitHub Pages and Jekyll.
